hadiths.english_translation: Adam and Moses disputed with each other. Moses said to him: You are Adam who deceived the people and caused them to exit from Paradise to the earth. Adam said to him: You are Moses whom Allah gave knowledge of all things and chose above the people with His message. He said: Yes. Adam said: Do you blame me for a matter that was written upon me to do before I was created? So Adam prevailed over Moses. And the Prophet ﷺ said: While Job was bathing naked, there fell upon him a locust of gold. Job began to gather it in his garment. His Lord called to him: O Job, did I not enrich you from what you see? He said: Yes, O Lord, but I have need of Your blessing.

hadiths.english_translation: I will not cease fighting the people until they say there is no god but Allah. When they say there is no god but Allah, they have protected their blood, wealth and lives from me except by right, and their reckoning is with Allah. And Paradise and Hell disputed. Hell said: I have been favored with the arrogant and the tyrants. Paradise said: So what is wrong with me that only the weak of the people, their lowest and their deceived enter me? Allah said to Paradise: You are my mercy, I show mercy through you to whomever I will of My servants. And He said to Hell: You are My punishment, I punish with you whomever I will of My servants. For each of you there is a fullness. As for Hell, it will not be full until He places His foot in it, then it will say: Enough, enough. Then it will be full and some of it will be folded upon another. And Allah does not wrong any of His creation. As for Paradise, Allah will create for it inhabitants.

hadiths.english_translation: When one of you uses stones or cleansing material, let him use an odd number. And Allah the Exalted said: When My servant thinks of doing a good deed, I record it for him as one good deed if he does not do it. When he does it, I record it for him as ten like it. And when he thinks of doing an evil deed, I forgive him as long as he does not do it. When he does it, I record it against him as one evil deed like it.

hadiths.english_translation: Had it not been for the Bani Israel, food would not have become rotten and meat would not have become stinking. And had it not been for Eve, no woman would have betrayed her husband ever. Allah created Adam upon His image, his height being sixty cubits. When He created him, He said: Go and greet those group of angels who are sitting, and listen to how they greet you, for it will be your greeting and the greeting of your offspring. He went and said: Peace be upon you. They said: Peace and the mercy of Allah be upon you. They added: and the mercy of Allah. So everyone who enters Paradise will enter with the form of Adam, his height being sixty cubits, and the creation has not ceased to diminish after that until now. The Angel of Death came to Moses and said to him: Respond to your Lord. Moses struck the eye of the Angel of Death and put it out. The angel returned to Allah and said: You sent me to Your servant who does not wish for death, and he has put out my eye. Allah restored his eye and said: Go back to My servant and say to him: Do you desire life? If you wish for life, place your hand on the back of an ox, and for every hair that your hand covers, you will live a year. He said: Then what? He said: Then you will die. He said: Now from near. He said: My Lord, bring me closer to the holy land by a stone's throw. The Prophet said: If I were there, I would show you his grave by the side of the road near the red sand hill.

hadiths.english_translation: The Bani Israel used to bathe naked, watching each other's private parts. Moses used to bathe alone. They said: By Allah, what prevents Moses from bathing with us except that he is having a hydrocele. One time he went to bathe and placed his garment on a stone, and the stone ran away with his garment. Moses rushed after it saying: My garment, stone! My garment, stone! Until the Bani Israel saw the private parts of Moses, and they said: By Allah, there is nothing wrong with Moses. The stone stood still after it had been seen, and he took his garment and began striking the stone. Abu Hurairah said: By Allah, there are six or seven marks on the stone from Moses' striking it.
